trans-unit.source: Represents a claim for a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token that asserts an authorization decision regarding access to a specific resource.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions.
The claims in a SAML assertion are represented by SAML statements.
The SAML specification defines a set of SAML statement types and one of them is a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement>.
A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement> asserts an authorization decision by a SAML authority regarding access to a specific resource.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionClaimResource> class represents a claim resource for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionStatement>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionClaimResource"></xref> class using the specified resource the subject is seeking access to, the authorization decision regarding the resource, the action sought on the resource, and the XML namespace in which the action is defined.
The following table details the properties set by the parameters passed to this constructor.
Parameter
Property
The resource the subject is seeking access to.
The XML namespace in which the action specified in the action parameter is defined.
The action sought by the subject on the resource specified in the resource parameter.
resource is `null`.
-or-
actionName is `null`.
Gets the authorization decision rendered by the SAML authority regarding the access to the resource by the subject.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionClaimResource.AccessDecision%2A> property corresponds to the `Decision` attribute of the `<AuthorizationDecisionStatement>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The authorization decision rendered by the SAML authority regarding the access to the resource by the subject.
Gets the action sought by the subject on the resource specified in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionClaimResource.Resource"></xref> property.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionClaimResource.ActionName%2A> property corresponds to the `<Action>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The action sought by the subject on the resource specified in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionClaimResource.Resource"></xref> property.
Gets the XML namespace in which the action specified in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionClaimResource.ActionName"></xref> property is defined.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionClaimResource.AccessDecision%2A> property corresponds to the `Namespace` attribute of the `<Action>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The XML namespace in which the action specified in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionClaimResource.ActionName"></xref> property is defined.
Returns a value that indicates whether the instance is equal to the specified object.
An object to compare to this instance.
`true` if obj is a and has the same value as this instance; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the hash code for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionClaimResource"></xref>.
A hash code for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionClaimResource"></xref>.
Gets the resource the subject is seeking access to.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorizationDecisionClaimResource.AccessDecision%2A> property corresponds to the `Resource` attribute of the `<AuthorizationDecisionStatement>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
A URI that represents the resource the subject is seeking access to.
